upiScam.title: UPI Payment Scam
upiScam.description: Learn to identify fake payment requests and refund scams

question1.situation: You receive a call asking for your UPI PIN to process a refund. What should you do?
question1.optionA: Share the PIN to get the refund quickly
question1.optionB: Refuse to share and report the call immediately
question1.optionC: Ask them to send an email first
question1.explanationA: Never share your UPI PIN! This is a scam. Your PIN is confidential.
question1.explanationB: Correct! Never share your UPI PIN. Report such calls to 1930.
question1.explanationC: While verification is good, the safest option is to refuse completely and report.

question2.situation: A payment request appears asking to 'collect' money instead of 'pay'. What is this?
question2.optionB: A scam attempting to make you send money
question2.explanationA: Correct! 'Collect' requests are used by scammers to trick you into sending money.
question2.explanationB: Incorrect. Refunds are always sent by the merchant, not collected.
question2.explanationC: This is not an error. It's a deliberate scam tactic.

phishing.title: Email Phishing Attack
phishing.description: Recognize and avoid phishing emails and fake links

question1.situation: An email claims your account will be closed. Click link to verify.
question1.optionB: Check sender email and report if suspicious
question1.explanationA: Wrong! Phishing emails use urgency to trick you.
question1.explanationB: Correct! Always verify sender and never click suspicious links.
question1.explanationC: Replying confirms your email is active. Better to ignore and report.

question2.situation: How can you identify a phishing email?
question2.optionA: Check for spelling errors and generic greetings
question2.explanationA: Correct! Phishing emails often have poor grammar and generic messages.
question2.explanationB: Incorrect! Many emails are phishing attempts.
question2.explanationC: You need to check sender, content, and links carefully.

fakeJob.title: Fake Job Offer Scam
fakeJob.description: Identify fraudulent job offers and recruitment scams

question1.situation: A job offer asks for payment for 'training materials'. Is this legitimate?
question1.optionA: Yes, companies often charge for training
question1.optionB: No, legitimate companies don't ask for payment
question1.optionC: Only if they provide a receipt
question1.explanationA: Incorrect! Legitimate companies never ask candidates to pay for jobs.
question1.explanationB: Correct! Any job requiring payment upfront is a scam.
question1.explanationC: Even with a receipt, this is a red flag for a scam.

question2.situation: What's a red flag in job postings?
question2.explanationA: Correct! Unrealistic promises are major red flags.
question2.explanationB: Detailed descriptions are actually good signs.
question2.explanationC: Company links are normal, but verify they're legitimate.

socialMediaHack.title: Social Media Account Hack
socialMediaHack.description: Secure and recover hacked social media accounts

question1.situation: Your account is hacked. First step?
question1.optionB: Use account recovery and change password
question1.explanationA: This won't help. Use official recovery options.
question1.explanationB: Correct! Use account recovery immediately and enable 2FA.
question1.explanationC: Deleting the app doesn't recover your account.

question2.situation: Best way to prevent account hacking?
question2.explanationA: Very unsafe! Use unique passwords for each account.
question2.explanationC: Never share passwords, even with friends.

investmentFraud.title: Investment Fraud Scheme
investmentFraud.description: Identify Ponzi schemes and investment scams

question1.situation: An investment promises 50% returns in one month. Your action?
question1.explanationA: Extremely unsafe! This is a classic Ponzi scheme.
question1.explanationB: Correct! Unrealistic returns always indicate fraud.
question1.explanationC: Don't risk it. Report to authorities immediately.

question2.explanationA: Correct! Always verify with SEBI or RBI databases.
question2.explanationB: Never trust ads. Scammers use fake promotions.
question2.explanationC: Referral schemes are often pyramid scams.

identityTheft.title: Identity Theft Prevention
identityTheft.description: Protect and monitor your personal information

question1.situation: Someone uses your Aadhaar details. What to do?
question1.explanationA: Never ignore! This is serious identity theft.
question1.explanationB: Correct! File FIR immediately and use Aadhaar lock feature.
question1.explanationC: Aadhaar doesn't have a password. Lock it on UIDAI portal.

question2.explanationA: Very dangerous! Only share when absolutely necessary.
question2.explanationB: Correct! Always watermark with purpose and date.
question2.explanationC: Never post ID documents on social media!
